thread.title: Youth wrestling coach pleads not guilty in sex abuse case
thread.title_full: Youth wrestling coach pleads not guilty in sex abuse case

title: Youth wrestling coach pleads not guilty in sex abuse case
text:
Youth wrestling coach in Portland area pleads not guilty in sex abuse case 
THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Published: 10/12/15 8:20 pm EDT - Updated: 10/12/15 8:20 pm EDT 
PORTLAND, Oregon â€” A youth wrestling coach who has worked with hundreds of children has pleaded not guilty to 10 counts of sexually abusing boys ages 10 to 13. 
The Oregonian reports ( http://goo.gl/BGnbta ) 25-year-old Wyatt DeRemer pleaded not guilty Monday to a 10-count indictment related to abusing four boys between 2007 and 2012. 
DeRemer is being held in Portland jail on $2.5 million bail. 
Court documents say that in an interview with Gresham police, DeRemer initially denied the allegations but then acknowledged they occurred. 
The Gresham-Barlow School District has said DeRemer served as a coach at Gresham High last school year and has also worked with wrestlers at the middle-school level. 
The police investigation began when parents of a high school student reported the coach had inappropriate contact with their son. 
Information from: The Oregonian, http://www.oregonlive.com
